conclusion: Plan to analyze the p-V diagram and use the ideal gas law to find the temperature in state B.
The image shows a p-V diagram for an ideal gas undergoing a process from state A to state B and then to state C, indicating a change in pressure and volume.
The process from state A to state B is isobaric (constant pressure), as indicated by the horizontal line AB.
The process from state B to state C is isothermal (constant temperature), as indicated by the vertical line BC.
The temperature of the gas in state C is given as 300 K.
Since the process BC is isothermal, the temperature of the gas in state B is the same as in state C.
The temperature of the gas in state B is 300 K.
